title: Ndlovu Youth Choir have stolen the show night after night on America's Got Talent, can they land the top prize?
text:
(CNN) On Tuesday, the South African Youth Choir Ndlovu stirred the soul of America with a powerful rendition of 'Toto's Africa.' on America's Got Talent.

That performance launched them into the history books as the first African act to reach the finals of the talent show.

pic.twitter.com/0cHbrFcsRc Tonight we were proud young ambassadors of a united Africa. Africa has the worlds youngest population and our hope is that our performance reflected the talent, opportunity and potential of millions of young people. One nation, one continent. #Africa #Agt — Ndlovu Youth Choir (@ChoirAfrica) September 18, 2019

It was the culmination of 16 weeks of thrilling live singing that has made them a crowd favorite on season 14 of the hit television show.

Their journey started in June when the youth choir delivered a lustrous performance of 'My African Dream' and received a standing ovation from the audience

They have not looked back since and have won a legion of fans around the world with their uplifting and moving performances.
description: On Tuesday, the South African Youth Choir Ndlovu stirred the soul of America with a powerful rendition of 'Toto's Africa.' on America's Got Talent, booking their place in the history books as the first African act to get to the finals.
